page.title: 01FELTWELL, A NORFOLK VILLAGE
page.content: Feltwell lies near where{Norfolk} {Suffolk}and{Cambridgeshire}meet. Built on a line of springs where the low chalk hills of{Breckland}slope to meet the black peaty soils of the { {Fens,}the village has grown from its Saxon beginnings to its present population of around 4000. Feltwell folk don't owe allegiance to any large town, having Thetford, (14 miles) King's Lynn, (21 miles) Downham Market (13 miles) Ely, (19 miles) and Bury St. Edmunds (28 miles) all to hand. A real mix of people live in the village - Farmers, industrial workers and service personell. R.A.F. Feltwell now houses American airmen and this has quite an influence on the nature of the village. People like to live here, many on new estates, although some complain of lack of amenities.
